Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

Sincerely,

ALLEGATION:
On 9/26/21, staff member allowed three youth to be unsupervised in a classroom
bathroom for 1-2 minutes to play a joke on staff. Youth are not supposed to be out
of line of sight.
INVESTIGATION:
2

A complaint was received on 9/28/21 stating this morning Staff 1 allowed Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth C to be unsupervised in the classroom bathroom for one to two
minutes. This put the children out of line of sight. The residents need to always be in
the line of sight. There are no allegations anything occurred in the bathroom. The
girls hid in the bathroom to play a joke on another staff member to pretend they were
missing. Staff 1 thought it would be more believable if just the girls hid in the
bathroom.
A similar incident took place earlier this month, Staff 1 hid in the bathroom with the
girls to play a joke on the staff. There were no additional allegations at that time. The
bathroom is a single person bathroom.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 9/29/21. She stated Staff 1 is not working
at the facility anymore. He was not in the bathroom with her and her peers. They
were just joking around. The first time it happened she was not involved. The second
time she was in the bathroom with Youth B and Youth C. They were in the bathroom
to hide from the other staff. Staff 1 knew they were in the bathroom. They just sat on
the floor and waited. Nothing happened. Youth A was too upset to answer any more
questions. She continuously asked to leave, and she finally became too agitated to
continue so she was allowed to leave the room.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 9/29/21. She stated they were playing a
prank by hiding in the bathroom so their peers and staff could not see them. While
they were in the bathroom the door remained opened and the staff could see them.
Staff 1 was pretending the girls went on the campus trail by themselves. She said
they came out when the other staff found them in the bathroom. Staff 1 was not in
the bathroom with them. Staff 1 was the staff that was there both times this
occurred. Youth B stated the bathroom is a single person bathroom. They are not
supposed to be in the bathroom with other youth unless they are getting water and
are of the same sex. While in the bathroom they squatted on the floor and tried not
to laugh.
A tour of the classroom was completed. The teacher was in the classroom. She
stated one time she found two girls and Staff 1 in the bathroom with the light off and
the door closed.
The classroom door was on the same wall as the bathroom. The bathroom door
swung out and would block anyone from seeing into the bathroom from the front of
the classroom and from the door into the classroom. The bathroom was a single
person bathroom with a toilet and a sink. The teacher’s desk was at the front of the
room opposite the door into the classroom. Anyone sitting at the desk could not see
into the bathroom or behind the door if the door was open.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility on 9/29/21. She stated two days ago they
were hiding in the classroom bathroom. Staff 1 was in the classroom. The bathroom
door was closed and the light was off. They were hiding so they could scare the
3

other classmates. Nothing happened while they were in the bathroom. She stated
one other time her and Youth B were in the bathroom and Staff 1 was at the door
with the door cracked open and the light off. Staff 1 was outside the door. She stated
nothing happened. They all stood on separate walls.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility on 9/29/21. The Chief Programs Officer (CPO)
sat in on the interview. He stated he is the education specialist. His class was in the
gym and because it is a co-ed class, he had Staff 1 take the girls back to the class
ahead of him with the boys. He said he left 1-2 minutes after the girls. When he got
to the classroom Staff 1 was sitting at the desk. Staff 1 told Staff 2 he let the girls
walk the trail on campus. He found the girls in the bathroom holding the door closed.
He told Staff 1 he could not do that, reported it to the supervisor and wrote an
Incident Report. A week prior he sent Staff 1 with the girls and when he got to the
classroom, he did not see them. He left the classroom to look for them and when he
came back the girls were in the classroom. He did not get a chance to follow-up with
Staff 1. Staff 2 stated he did not have any concerns with Staff 1's boundaries with
the girls. He stated Youth C was upset when she heard Staff 1 was no longer
employed for the facility.
Staff 1’s employee file indicated he did not have any disciplines and had been
working at the facility since 7/27/21. Staff 1 went over supervision of youth and the
Staff Ratio procedures during his initial training when he was hired. It is also covered
in the Staff Manual that all employees sign indicating they received and reviewed.
Youth A’s case file indicates she is aggressive with peers and adults.
Youth B’s case file indicates she self-harms, is aggressive, and has suicidal and
homicidal ideation.
Youth C’s case file indicates she is aggressive, self-harms, and has inappropriate
sexual behaviors.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 10/7/2021. He stated in the classroom
where he worked there were three girls and four boys. On this day he took the girls
back to the classroom from gym. The teacher and Staff 2 took the boys. They were
five to six seconds ahead of the boys, so they arrived to the classroom first. Prior to
that day they had pulled a prank on the teacher and the girls wanted to do it again.
He said there is a single bathroom in the classroom. He sat at his desk in front of the
classroom while the girls went into the bathroom with the door opened so the
camera in the classroom could see. He was the one to suggest the girls hide in the
bathroom with the door open. While the girls were in the bathroom, he heard the
door close. The girls were in the bathroom with the door closed for 30 seconds to a
minute. He stated it just slipped his mind that they were not supposed to be in there
together with the door closed. When Staff 2 came into the classroom Staff 1 told him
that the girls went for a walk on the trail. Staff 2 panicked then the girls were asked
to leave the bathroom. Staff 2 told Staff 1 that they needed to be able to see the
4

youth. Staff 1 told Staff 2 he was sorry. The supervisor then pulled him aside and
the therapist was there. He tried to joke with them by saying “Uh oh. I’m in trouble
with the teacher.” He told the supervisor everything that happened, and she sent him
home.
Staff 1 was asked about the previous prank, and he stated the teacher was
lighthearted and always tried to make things fun. It was the same set up the girls got
back from the gym before the boys. The girls wanted to pull a prank, so they hid in
the bathroom with the door open. He stated with the door to the bathroom opened so
the teacher would not be able to see them when she first walked into the classroom.
He reported he was standing behind the door and the girls were in the bathroom. He
clarified and said he had one foot inside the bathroom and the rest of him was out of
the bathroom. They were in the bathroom for 20-30 seconds. He stated he thought
the teacher found them but reiterated that the door to the bathroom was open.
The facilities Staff Ratio Procedures state direct care staff members are required to
maintain line-of-sight supervision of the youth except when youth are in their
individual sleeping rooms or bathrooms.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4109 Program statement.
(1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
program statement which specifically addresses all of the
following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission,
care, safety, and supervision, methods for addressing
residents’ needs, implementation of treatment plans, and
discharge of residents.
ANALYSIS: Staff 1 admitted he allowed the three girls to enter the bathroom
together and he did not intervene when they closed the
bathroom door. Staff 1 could not see all three girls while they
were in the bathroom together.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
